author: Rob Moran
title: Brit Awards: Fans in uproar over Chris Martin's tribute to George Michael
text:
Chris Martin's "duet" with George Michael was savaged by viewers. Photo: ITV 
Before Martin's miscue, the tribute had started emotionally enough. 
Michael's former Wham bandmates Andrew Ridgeley and backup singers Shirlie Holliman and Helen 'Pepsi' DeMacque fondly recalled their salad days with the star, spent in bedrooms listening to their '80s heroes Haircut 100, Aztec Camera and The Human League. 
"We were two boys who shared a love of life-affirming music and a sense that we understood it," Ridgeley said. 
"His is a legacy of unquestionable brilliance which will resonate years to come. I loved him and in turn, we, you, have been loved," he added, fighting back tears. Watch Chris Martin perform A Different Corner at the #BRITs as a tribute to George Michael https://t.co/kMlNpX8qji pic.twitter.com/yVscJN4xMj â€” Coldplaying (@coldplaying) February 22, 2017 
But somewhere, Michael must be impishly sabotaging his own morbid tributes from afar. 
Last week, singer Adele flubbed her own live tribute to the pop star at the Grammys , awkwardly interrupting a sombre version of his slinky sex jam Fastlove to demand a restart. 
"I'm sorry for swearing and I'm sorry for starting again," she said after a trademark expletive. "I can't mess this up for him." 
Despite the mistake, the emotion won over viewers, with even TV star Ellen tweeting, "You get every do-over you ever need." Advertisement
